Hi,

thank you

Hi,

I'm trying to create a web service from a java file and I'm obtainig the IWAB0524E Error updating Axis deploy.wsdd

My configuration es:
OS: windows xp sp2
Eclipse: Version: 3.2.1 Build id: M20060921-0945
WST: 1.5.2
tomcat server: 5.5.20
I tried both jre 1.5.0_10 and 1.6.0

Any suggestions, workarounds?

Mark, please try to recreate this problem with the info provided by the various users.  You might have to provide a patched version of the plugin JAR with some trace code in UpdateAxisWSDDFileTask to make sure we're getting the right URL and a viable stream around deploy.xsl so that the originator and various people who had reported this problem (on the CC list) have a chance to send us more info.

Hi. I have experienced exactly this same bug. I've tried everything I can think of to fix it, and nothing seems to work. HOWEVER, when I switched to a different computer and tried exactly the same settings of Eclipse, it worked. So it's something peculiar to my computer settings.
Was "fixed" for me when I moved the eclipse folder from the Program Files folder to the root of the drive.
thank you for your help and suggestions!!!
thank you for your help and suggestion

Created an attachment (id=60016)
org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis.creation.ui plugin jar that outputs debug info

Thanks to everyone for providing this information!

I haven't been able to reproduce this error on my machine. I've tried on wtp 1.5.3 and 2.0 M5, using various JREs and install locations but I could not recreate this error.

Christian, I suspect you may be right. My guess is that something might be wrong with the url being passed in.  The comments above about moving the eclipse install directory to the root from "program files" make me wonder if spaces in the path cause a problem, but I have tried using a version of eclipse that is installed in folder with spaces and did not run into this.

I've attached a modified plugin that writes some debug output to a file named bug128419-debug.txt in your workspace.  To use this replace the org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis.creation.ui jar in your plugins directory with this one and run through the scenario that causes the problem. This plugin was tested with WTP 2.0 from feb 21 and should work in 2.0M5.   If anyone who is experiencing this problem would be willing to try this out and attach the output to this bug it should give me a better idea of what's going on.

When I had the eclipse folder at c:\Program Files the error occurred and when I moved it to c:\ it did not occur anymore. I left the workspace folder where it was (somewhere way down the folder structure).
On my Austrian machine c:\Programme\eclipse worked fine.

I think my debugging plug-in was meant to be used with the WTP 2.0 Stream.  Maybe my debugging plug-in is now out of date, I haven't tried it in a while. I create axis web service proxies almost daily and I have never run into this problem and from the comments it sounds like this only happens on certain set ups. I'll need to do some digging to figure out what might be going on here, but so far I have not been able to reproduce this problem.  Maybe it could be related to the JRE being used, since according to the Xalan FAQ some Sun JREs have outdated versions of Xalan.

For now some things to try:
1. Install eclipse into location with no spaces in the workspace
2. Try running eclipse using a different jre. (use -vm "C:\path\to\java.exe" option) when starting eclipse.

D.A:, what JRE (vendor and version) are you using.  What version of WTP? What operating system? What folder did you install eclipse to?  It would be helpful if I could figure out what configuration triggers this error.

I am using java 1.6 from Java with windows XP.  How do I find what WTP I'm using?  I don't seem to see it.  I'm using whatever the download is in Calisto after an Eclipse 3.2.2 install.  I see WST version 1.5.3 and JST 1.5.3.  I've tried working with workspaces in C:\\workspace and C:\\Documents and Settings\user\workspace with the same results.  I've tried this on many different with the same set up.  I've had this working in the past.  I will try changing my JRE to 1.5 and see what happens.
Same thing with Java 1.5 from Sun.

Thanks D.A.  I have never used the callisto installer, I download the zip files from the WTP site. You have WTP 1.5.3 (WTP contains the subprojects WST and JST).  I think what has worked for other people experiencing this problem was not changing their workspace location, but changing where eclipse was installed, i.e. the folder where eclipse.exe lives.  Try installing eclipse into a folder like C:\eclipse or some other path that doesn't contain spaces. (not "C:\Program Files\eclipse" or similar)
Ok, when I put eclipse at C:\eclipse\eclipse.exe it works!  This is not ideal, but good enough for now.  Thanks for the help.

I just downloaded eclipse 3.2.2 to C:\Program Files\eclipse, and used the updater to get WST/JST and all the requirements.  I used the Sun JDK 1.5.0_10 as my JRE.  I created several web services and proxies for tomcat 5.5 and didn't run into any problems.  I realize that changing the install location may not be ideal, but I have not been able to get to the bottom of what is causing this yet.

That's pretty much what I do too.  One thing about mine is that I'm redoing a previous web service after I made changes to the parameters of a method.  I already had a wsdl and a deploy.wsdd that needed to be copied over.  I don't know else could be the difference.  I could  point you to my svn repository for my web app if you want.  It's really not that big of a deal for me.  I can work with it the way it is.
Kathy, since I am heading back to school I am going to leave this bug with you.  Maybe you will have better luck trying to reproduce this.

I just experiment the same problem on WTP 1.5.4 with eclipse 3.2.2.
The workaround is running but my purpose is to try to find the bug.
The attached jar is only running on wtp 2.0 and that requires eclipse 3.3 and I do not want to install it now.
Is it possible to have the debug jar file for wtp 1.5.4 ?

I am able to reproduce this in the 1.5.5 and 2.0 streams.  I found that I need to:
1. Put WTP under the "Program Files" directory.
2. Use the Windows explorer and double click on eclipse.exe to launch (only needed in 1.5.5, I was able to reproduce the problem in WTP 2.0 launching with the command line)

To resolve the problem, instead of converting a bundle URL to localURL, we can go straight to openStream on a bundleURL and pass that to the StreamSource.  I tested this in both 1.5.5 and 2.0, which fixes the problem.

Kelvin

Created an attachment (id=81638)
Patch to create an InputStream directly from a plugin bundle
verified patch solves the problem in WTP 2.0

Patch reviewed and tested.  Thanks Kelvin.

I've committed and released the change to HEAD as v200710302058.  It will be in the WTP 3.0 build.
*** Bug 211053 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Releasing the change to R2_0_maintenance as v200711291741 since others found the same problem in bug 211053.
